title: Keen 2 Level Competition: Results
content:
Well, after a not so rousing bout of voting (heh), The Results for the Keen 2 Level Competition are In!

First off, if you want to pick up this challenging pack but still don't have it, get it here: [url=http://levellord.toxicsheep.com/Keenstuff/Keen%20Day%20Levelpack.zip]levellord.toxicsheep.com/...elpack.zip[/url]

Here are the results:

Most Keenish Award. Winner: Level 3, with three votes. (Runners up: Levels 6 and 9, each gaining a vote and a runner-up vote.)
Scrub Award. Winner: Level 2, with only two votes. (Runners up: Levels 5 and 10, with a vote each, and Levels 9 and 11 with a runner-up vote each.)
Elite Award. Winner: Level 7, hands down. Four votes. (Runners up: Level 4, with one vote, and Level 8, with two runner-up votes.)

Thanks to all who made these levels, and those who participated in voting as well! The pack was great, helped me de-rust those old skills.

Feel free to comment or review or whatever you feel like on this topic from now on. Also, if Levellass could post the names of the level creators, it'd be great to be able to congratulate the winners properly (and know who else took part). --------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Re: Keen 2 Level Competition: Results
content: Sorry about not voting - I really should have gotten round to it, but I struggled so much with all of the levels (even mine) that I couldn't summon up the will to finish it. Mine was Level 11, by the way.

title: Whee
content:
Well, mine was Level09--glad to know I'm a runner-up for Keen spirit!

This was a fun competition, and I'm sorely disappointed that more people didn't vote! Thanks for finally closing the voting topic and compiling the results, Flaose.

title: Re: Whee
content:
Mine was level 2. W00t, I won something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ------------------

title: Re: Whee
content:
I'm disappointed. When I mentioned the idea of a Keen 2 Level competition, I thought it was going to be a great experience, fun levels, etc. But somehow these levels are not as good as the ones in the Keen 1 Level competition. There's a lack of something in them.

That's why I didn't vote.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Whee
content:
Well, I must admit I thought the levels in both competitions, though generally good, did suffer a bit from a tendency to place too much focus on difficulty. Although maybe I'm just not very good at Commander Keen...------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Whee
content:
Good job everybody, I wish more people had voted though.

Looks like I'm most Keenish again [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Mine was level 3, the hint was the Tantalus Seattle. Sorry to everyone for my level being a bit difficult, I really had no intention of making it so hard! While testing it I thought it was a walk in the park [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]

Some quick comments about my level:

Xky brought up the point that the drop into flames by the guard robot was a bit unfair. I'd have to agree, I originally had it as a safe drop, but I felt that the rest of the level was too easy. I guess I was wrong.

Also the part with those elites is actually pretty simple, just hide outside the entrance to the room and fire shots in between the blue wall tiles and the white/cyan tiles.

In response to DaVince and the red key card: after getting past the guard robot, fall to the left. Navigate the platforms, kill the grunt, then use the scrub to get the key card. After that escape by jumping up the green barrels.

title: Re: Whee
content:
Mine was level08.


Is there going to be a keen3 level competition?

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Whee
content:
I forgot which level I did; it was the one with a lot of switches. I'd publish who did what, but I lost that information.

I think this was a pretty good competition as they go, next up sometim, Keen 3! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Eeem!
content:
Mine was Level 10. As with my Keen 1 level, the focus was on atmosphere more than difficulty.

[hr]Xky Level 10 -- I'm really torn, here. The level is a visual hodgepodge of map tiles, wasted space, and flashing lights... but the gameplay of the level is fine--pretty enjoyable, in fact! I really don't know what to say; I can't decide if I love it or hate it!
[hr]This comment confused me. Where is the visual hodgepodge of map tiles? Just curious.

I think we need a different format for the next competition. Perhaps a level size limit, and some way of moderating difficulty. I couldn't complete any of these levels besides my own.

It's intriguing that even the most insanely difficult of levels are easy if they're your own. That is a helpful lesson to take from this.

title: Re: Eeem!
content:
A level size limit is a good idea, that's generally the reason levels are too difficult for me.

I can't think of a good way to modify level difficulty besides level size, but I think you're definitely right, the level is always a lot harder than the creator thinks it is. With this in mind I think we'll all be able to make better levels next time around.

title: Re: Eeem!
content:
Aye, the Keen 3 will be our best yet then! But first, let's wait for Andy's competition to end.
